title: Basic SerolyzeR functionalities
text: basic functionality SerolyzeR package reading raw MBA data. present package’s functionalities, use sample dataset Covid OISE study, pre-loaded package. might want replace variables paths files local disk, test package data. Firstly, let us load dataset object. object encapsulates information plate, sample names, analyte names, MFI values. details object, check documentation executing command ?Plate. read_luminex_data() function used , reads data CSV plate file layout file outputs object. method allows also advanced options, overriding information files, setting data reading options, e.g. Luminex file format (xPONENT INTELLIFLEX) file separators data encoding. details function, encourage explore documentation executing command ?read_luminex_data. also detects automatically sample types, using internal method [translate_sample_names_to_sample_types()]. method uses sample names, sourced either layout file CSV plate file, determine sample types. types samples stored sample_types field plate object. sample types used distinguish standard curve samples, control samples test samples. documentation function contains details sample types detection.
code: library(SerolyzeR)  plate_filepath <- system.file("extdata", "CovidOISExPONTENT.csv", package = "SerolyzeR", mustWork = TRUE) # get the filepath of the csv dataset  layout_filepath <- system.file("extdata", "CovidOISExPONTENT_layout.xlsx", package = "SerolyzeR", mustWork = TRUE)   plate <- read_luminex_data(plate_filepath, layout_filepath) # read the data #> Reading Luminex data from: /home/runner/work/_temp/Library/SerolyzeR/extdata/CovidOISExPONTENT.csv #> using format xPONENT #>  #> New plate object has been created with name: CovidOISExPONTENT! #> plate #> Plate with 96 samples and 30 analytes

title: Basic SerolyzeR functionalities
text: loaded plate object, may process using function [process_plate()]. function fits model analyte using standard curve samples. default, computes RAU values analyte using corresponding model. computed RAU values saved CSV file specified folder parameter output_dir file specified name filename, default based plate name normalisation type - function also allows normalisation nMFI values, details method may found nMFI section document, documentation ?get_nmfi function. function fits model analyte using standard curve samples. default, computes Relative Antibody Units (RAU) analyte based fitted model. computed RAU values saved CSV file directory specified output_dir parameter. output file named according filename parameter. filename provided, function automatically generates one based plate name selected normalisation type. Additionally, function supports normalisation normalised Median Fluorescence Intensity (nMFI) values. details normalisation approach can found nMFI section document documentation [get_nmfi()]. get information function, check ?process_plate. , execute function plate object save output temporary directory. can take look slice produced dataframe (overcrowd article). automate processing plates, can also use [process_file] [process_dir] methods. former processes single file, latter processes files directory. [process_file] parses plate file saves normalised output files specified directory. example execution function shown . saves RAU nMFI values output_dir, working similarly [process_plate()] function. Additionally option produce single plate report, can enabled generate_report = TRUE parameter. report saved directory output files, name based plate name. detailed description reports, refer . [process_dir()] processes files specified directory. description method can found separate .

title: Basic SerolyzeR functionalities
text: package can plot RAU along MFI values, allowing manual inspection standard curve.  can also plot standard curve different analytes data types. list available analytes plate can accessed using command plate$analyte_names. default, operations performed Median value samples; option can selected data_type parameter function.   plot may used assess standard curve’s quality anticipate potential issues data. instance, plotted standard curve analyte, , notice Median value sample RAU 39.06 abnormally large, may indicate problem data.   plotting function options, selecting axis log scale applied reversing curve. detailed information can found function documentation, accessed executing command ?plot_standard_curve_analyte. Another valuable method inspecting potential errors data plot_mfi_for_analyte(). method plots MFI values standard curve samples given analyte along boxplot MFI values test samples. helps identify outlier samples check test samples within range standard curve samples.   Spike_6P analyte, MFI values don’t fall within range standard curve samples, problematic model. test RAU values extrapolated (point) standard curve, may lead incorrect results. package allows also straightforward way adjust MFI values using background samples. , can use plate$blank_adjustment method, :
code: plot_standard_curve_analyte(plate, analyte_name = "OC43_S") plot_standard_curve_analyte(plate, analyte_name = "RBD_wuhan", data_type = "Mean") plot_standard_curve_analyte(plate, analyte_name = "RBD_wuhan", data_type = "Avg Net MFI") plot_standard_curve_analyte(plate, analyte_name = "ME") plot_standard_curve_analyte(plate, analyte_name = "ME", log_scale = "all") plot_mfi_for_analyte(plate, analyte_name = "OC43_S") plot_mfi_for_analyte(plate, analyte_name = "Spike_6P") plate$blank_adjusted # verify if the data is already adjusted #> [1] FALSE plate$blank_adjustment() #> Plate with 96 samples and 30 analytes

previous_headings: Quality control and normalisation details > Normalisation
title: Basic SerolyzeR functionalities
text: nplr package fits model using formula: \[ y = B + \frac{T - B}{[1 + 10^{b \cdot (x_{mid} - x)}]^s},\] : \(y\) predicted value, MFI case, \(x\) independent variable, dilution standard curve samples case, \(B\) bottom plateau - right horizontal asymptote, \(T\) top plateau - left horizontal asymptote, \(b\) slope curve inflection point, \(x_{mid}\) x-coordinate inflection point, \(s\) asymmetric coefficient. equation referred Richards’ equation. information model can found nplr package documentation.

previous_headings: Quality control and normalisation details > Normalisation
title: Basic SerolyzeR functionalities
text: reversing logistic function, can predict dilution samples based MFI values. RAU value predicted dilution sample multiplied \(1,000,000\). limit extrapolation error (values maximum RAU value standard curve samples), clip predictions \(M\) over_max_extrapolation user controlled parameter predict.Model() function. default over_max_extrapolation set \(0\). Warning: High dose hook effect affects prediction truncation (clipping). high dose hook effect detected exclude standard curve calculations samples dilutions higher equal 1/200. cause truncation values next greatest dilution multiplied \(1,000,000\).

title: Basic SerolyzeR functionalities
text: default, nplr model transforms x values using log10 function. create model specific analyte, use create_standard_curve_model_analyte function, fits returns model analyte. Since model object contains characteristics parameters fitted regression model. model can used predict RAU values samples based MFI values. output shows critical parameters fitted model. predicted values may used plot standard curve, can compared sample values.   can see , predicting RAU analytes observed high dose hook effect, truncation level changes RAU value corresponding first sample dilution 1/200 (1/400 case, RAU = 2500).  Apart plotting, package can predict values samples plate. dataframe contains original MFI values predicted RAU values based model. order allow extrapolation (certain value) can set over_max_extrapolation positive value. illustrate can look prediction plots. plot_standard_curve_analyte_with_model() takes additional parameters passes predict method can visually see effect over_max_extrapolation parameter.
code: model <- create_standard_curve_model_analyte(plate, analyte_name = "OC43_S")  model #> Instance of the Model class fitted for analyte ' OC43_S ':  #>  - fitted with 5 parameters #>  - using 11 samples #>  - using log residuals (mfi):  TRUE  #>  - using log dilution:  TRUE  #>  - top asymptote: 28414.96  #>  - bottom asymptote: 38.60885  #>  - goodness of fit: 0.9970645  #>  - weighted goodness of fit: 0.9998947 plot_standard_curve_analyte_with_model(plate, model, log_scale = c("all")) plot_standard_curve_analyte_with_model(plate, model, log_scale = c("all"), plot_asymptote = FALSE) model_hdh <- create_standard_curve_model_analyte(plate, analyte_name = "RBD_omicron") plot_standard_curve_analyte_with_model(plate, model_hdh, log_scale = c("all")) mfi_values <- plate$data$Median$OC43_S head(mfi_values) #> [1]   43.0 4193.0 1982.0 1308.0  681.0  365.5 predicted_rau <- predict(model, mfi_values)  head(predicted_rau) #>            RAU    MFI #> 1     2.375258   43.0 #> 2 20000.000000 4193.0 #> 3  8326.658518 1982.0 #> 4  5240.371360 1308.0 #> 5  2556.577252  681.0 #> 6  1242.668884  365.5 model <- create_standard_curve_model_analyte(plate, analyte_name = "Spike_6P") plot_standard_curve_analyte_with_model(plate, model, log_scale = c("all")) plot_standard_curve_analyte_with_model(plate, model, log_scale = c("all"), over_max_extrapolation = 100000)

title: Multiplate SerolyzeR functionalities
text: read directory , need import library SerolyzeR run single command process_dir(). function reads files directory processes . option generate 3 tabular outputs (similarly process_file() function). : - MFI (mean fluorescence intensity) - raw input MFI values, optional blank adjustment - nMFI (normalised mean fluorescence intensity) - normalised values, optional blank adjustment normalisation reference sample - RAU (relative antibody units) - normalised values, optional blank adjustment transformed relative antibody units output types can selected normalisation_types parameter, vector tabular outputs generated. default parameter equals possible values - c("RAU", "nMFI", "MFI"). Now, discuss method works describe important parameters. default, saves outputs input directory, can changed output_dir parameter. tutorial, set output directory temporary directory, can created tempdir() function. also specify format input files, xPONENT case. format parameter can either set xPONENT, INTELLIFLEX NULL. case format NULL, function try infer format based filename. details, refer reader documentation [process_dir] function. One useful features process_dir() function enables us preprocessing steps one go. setting merge_outputs parameter TRUE, method output single file data plates. useful want analyse data multiple plates . method also supports automatic generation HTML reports, enabled setting parameter generate_reports TRUE, single plate reports, generate_multiplate_report TRUE, multiplate report. default values set FALSE. Remember, want read files properly, need follow naming convention files. layout file name plate file, added suffix _layout. detailed description convention, along list possible arguments can found documentation function, can accessed ?process_dir command. Now, let us investigate merged output process_dir() function, contains data samples analytes, data type: MFI, nMFI RAU. detailed description normalised output single plate, refer reader . detailed description reports, refer reader . interested specific plots genrerated package, quality control single multiple plates, refer vignette . Let us investigate output directory files created. Since, selected merge_outputs parameter TRUE, see 3 files output directory: merged_MFI_{current_timestamp}.csv, merged_nMFI_{current_timestamp}.csv merged_RAU_{current_timestamp}.csv. file standard CSV dataframe. rows correspond samples columns analytes. first column plate name sample originates, second one sample name. remaining columns contain analytes.

However, can obtain similar information visually using plot_layout function. helps quickly asses whether layout plate correctly read Luminex layout file. function takes plate object argument.  plot shows layout plate. wells coloured according type sample. user familiar colour scheme package, option turn legend. can done setting show_legend parameter FALSE. plot window resized, recommended function rerun adjust scaling plot. Sometimes, whole layout may shifted legend plotted. solve issue, one stretch window toward layout shift, everything adjusted automatically.

title: SerolyzeR plots
text: plot_counts function allows us visualize counts analyte plate. plot useful quickly spotting wells count low interpret results high confidence. function takes plate object analyte name arguments. function return error message typo analyte name.  plot shows analyte “OC43_NP_NA” counts plate. wells coloured according count analyte. -low values marked red, values edge threshold marked yellow, rest marked green. option show legend setting show_legend parameter TRUE. also option show colours without counts setting show_counts parameter FALSE. provides cleaner plot without counts.

title: SerolyzeR plots

Parameter called monochromatic default value TRUE. results plots different shades blue plate. recent plates darker older ones almost white. helps quickly visualize drift calibration equipment time. monochromatic parameter set FALSE, variety colours plates, can useful comparing many plates. plate distinct others, can helpful looking outliers.  useful parameters function—mainly legend_type. default set NULL, means legend type determined based monochromatic value. monochromatic equal TRUE, legend type set date; FALSE, legend type set plate_name. user can override behavior explicitly setting legend_type date plate_name. Additionally, user wants play around legend position, parameter legend_position help. simply specifies legend positioned - bottom, top, left right plot. default set bottom. might occur situation, plate names really long, simply fit legend box. situations, prepared max_legend_items_per_row legend_text_size parameters. first one automatically decides many legend elements placed one row legend. default set 3. second parameter sets font size legend.  play around additional theme settings plots produced methods, can also use base ggplot2 methods. , need modify ggplot2 object. , add horizontal line, highlight threshold also modify title bit.

title: SerolyzeR plots
text: plot_levey_jennings function allows us visualize Levey-Jennings plot given analyte. plot useful spotting trends data, shifts drifts data. function takes list_of_plates analyte_name mandatory arguments. list_of_plates can obtained process_dir function, reads plates directory, recommended way creating list plates.  plot shows Levey-Jennings plot analyte “” samples dilution “1/100”. default value dilution “1/400”. sd_lines parameter allows us set distance horizontal lines mean. example, sd_lines = c(1, 2) plot four lines ±1SD ± 2SD, SD standard deviation data. default value sd_lines parameter c(1.96), corresponds approximately 95% confidence interval normal distribution. means two horizontal lines drawn ±1.96 times standard deviation mean, highlighting typical range expected variation. Values falling outside lines may indicate outliers points requiring investigation. Levey-Jennings plot additional parameters can improve readibility. instance, can replace x-label actual plate names, dates examination - using plate_labels parameter. can create congested labels, overcome issue, xlabels can rotated label_angle parameter. Legend can also positioned different places legend_position parameter. make plot analysis easier, zoomed factor 1.5 y-axis.
code: plot_levey_jennings(list_of_plates, "Adenovirus.T3", dilution = "1/100", sd_lines = c(1, 2, 3)) plot_levey_jennings(list_of_plates, "Adenovirus.T3", dilution = "1/100", sd_lines = c(1, 2, 3), plate_labels = "name", label_angle = 30)

title: SerolyzeR HTML reports
text: SerolyzeR package provides two reports: - plate report can generated using generate_plate_report() function, - Levey-Jennings report can generated using generate_levey_jennings_report() function. HTML report optimized size sent via email. first one contains summary plate. includes information plate, layout plate, preview standard curves, detailed information analytes. second one contains information quality control time. includes plots stacked standard curves Levey-Jennings plots analyte.

title: SerolyzeR HTML reports
text: present functionality, use sample dataset Covid OISE study, pre-loaded package. Firstly, let us load dataset plate object. generate report, need use generate_plate_report() function. one parameter needs set, plate object. Generation report takes seconds, please patient. can take minute large plate. Default report 4 main sections: important information plate  layout plate  preview standard curves  Detailed information analytes: section tabs analyte, user can select analyte interest.
code: library(SerolyzeR)  plate_filepath <- system.file("extdata", "CovidOISExPONTENT.csv", package = "SerolyzeR", mustWork = TRUE) layout_filepath <- system.file("extdata", "CovidOISExPONTENT_layout.xlsx", package = "SerolyzeR", mustWork = TRUE) plate <- read_luminex_data(plate_filepath, layout_filepath) #> Reading Luminex data from: /home/runner/work/_temp/Library/SerolyzeR/extdata/CovidOISExPONTENT.csv #> using format xPONENT #>  #> New plate object has been created with name: CovidOISExPONTENT! #> plate #> Plate with 96 samples and 30 analytes generate_plate_report(plate)

title: SerolyzeR HTML reports
text: plate report displays warnings nice visual manner. now, two types warnings supported: - high dose hook warning - informs user high dose hook given analyte - bad coverage warning - shows 25% test samples MFI value highest standard curve point warnings displayed detailed information analytes section.

title: SerolyzeR HTML reports
text: user can customize report setting additional parameters. generate_plate_report() function following optional parameters: additional_notes - string additional notes added report notes looks like report:  counts_lower_threshold - lower threshold counts plot, works way plot_counts function used change threshold green yellow colours counts_higher_threshold - higher threshold counts plot, works way plot_counts function used change threshold yellow red colours filename - name output HTML report file. provided equals NULL, output filename based plate name, precisely: {plate_name}_report.html. default plate_name filename input file contains plate data. details, please refer documentation Plate object. passed filename contain .html extension, default extension .html added. Filename can also path file, e.g. path//file.html. case, output_dir filename joined together. However, passed filepath absolute path output_dir parameter also provided, output_dir parameter ignored. file already exists specified filepath, function overwrite . output_dir - directory output CSV file saved. Please note directory path provided create necessary directories (including parent directories) exist. equals NULL current working directory used. Default ‘reports’.
code: notes <- " This is an example of additional notes that can be added to the report. The notes support markdown syntax, for example: **Author: Jane Doe** - bold *Date: 2024-10-28* - italic ~~Completed~~ - strikethrough H~2~O - subscripts X^2^ - superscripts [text that will be displayed](https://www.google.com) - link to resource  Ordered list: 1. First item 2. Second item 3. Third item  Unordered list: - First item - Second item - Third item  > This is a blockquote  #### This is a heading ##### This is a subheading ###### This is a subsubheading  Even though headings #, ##, ### are supported, it is recommended not to use them, as the report has its own structure that is built around ### headings. " generate_plate_report(plate, additional_notes = notes) generate_plate_report(plate,   additional_notes = notes,   counts_lower_threshold = 10,   counts_higher_threshold = 100,   filename = "example_report.html",   output_dir = "reports_from_new_plates" )

title: SerolyzeR HTML reports
text: present functionality, use sample dataset Covid OISE study, pre-loaded package. Firstly, let us load dataset list_of_plates object. generate report, need use generate_levey_jennings_report() function. two parameters need set, : - list_of_plates - list Plate instances, recommended generate process_dir function - report_title - title report Generation report takes several minutes, please patient. can take around 5 minutes reports 30 plates. Default report 3 main sections: important information report section contains information report, number plates, number analytes, list dilutions, date range plates. also contains list plates used crate report. list can hidden clicking “Show/hide plates” button. Layout plate part report contains plot layout plate. create visualization, first plate list (oldest one) used. Detailed information analytes section contains tabs analyte. tab contains two types plots: stacked standard curves Levey-Jennings plots. First type plot shows stacked standard curves plate, two version plot included report: monochromatic colored. second type plot, Levey-Jennings plot. plot shows concentration analyte time. default plotted two charts dilution “1/100” “1/400”.
code: dir <- system.file("extdata", "multiplate_reallife_reduced",   package = "SerolyzeR", mustWork = TRUE )  # Create a temporary directory for the output output_dir <- tempdir(check = TRUE) dir.create(output_dir) list_of_plates <- process_dir(dir,   return_plates = TRUE,   format = "xPONENT",   output_dir = output_dir )  # Clean up the output directory unlink(output_dir, recursive = TRUE) generate_levey_jennings_report(list_of_plates, report_title = "Example study")

title: Reading, Quality Control and Preprocessing of MBA (Multiplex Bead Assay) Data
text: package simple tool handles various raw data formats produced Multiplex Bead Assay (MBA). short, reads unstructured, raw data , e.g., Luminex device outputs normalised well-structured data, can used later advanced downstream analysis. package includes three main steps preprocessing data: data reading manipulation quality control data normalisation graphical overview package can seen image :  SerolyzeR package developed within PvSTATEM initiative. project received funding European Union’s Horizon Europe research innovation program grant agreement 101057665. Previously, package named PvSTATEM, rebranded SerolyzeR better reflect purpose scope.

what: Logistic regression model for the standard curve — Model
title: Logistic regression model for the standard curve — Model
text: Model class wrapper around nplr model. allows predict RAU (Relative Antibody Unit) values directly MFI values given sample. nplr model fitted using formula: $$y = B + \frac{T - B}{(1 + 10^{b \cdot (x_{mid} - x)})^s},$$ : \(y\) predicted value, MFI case, \(x\) independent variable, dilution case, \(B\) bottom plateau - right horizontal asymptote, \(T\) top plateau - left horizontal asymptote, \(b\) slope curve inflection point, \(x_{mid}\) x-coordinate inflection point, \(s\) asymmetric coefficient. equation referred Richards' equation. information model can found nplr package documentation. model fitted data, RAU values can predicted using predict.Model() method. RAU value simply predicted dilution value (using standard curve) given MFI multiplied 1,000 000 readable value. information differences dilution, RAU MFI values, please see Normalisation section Basic SerolyzeR functionalities vignette .

title: Plate Object — Plate
text: Plate object represents Luminex assay plate stores data related samples, analytes, metadata, batch information. object typically created functions read_luminex_data(), process_file(), process_dir(). provides methods accessing manipulating data, including retrieving specific analyte measurements, filtering sample type, performing blank adjustments.

title: Calculate Normalised MFI (nMFI) Values for a Plate — get_nmfi
text: Normalised MFI (nMFI) simple, model-free metric used compare test sample responses relative fixed concentration standard curve. particularly useful model fitting (e.g., RAU calculation) unreliable possible, test sample intensities fall outside standard curve range. function locates standard samples specified dilution divides test sample’s MFI corresponding standard MFI value analyte.

title: Calculate Normalised MFI (nMFI) Values for a Plate — get_nmfi
text: RAU values generally preferred antibody quantification, require successful model fitting standard curve. may feasible : test samples produce MFI values outside range standard curve. standard curve poorly shaped missing critical points. cases, nMFI serves useful alternative, allowing plate--plate comparison without need extrapolation.

title: Calculate Normalised MFI (nMFI) Values for a Plate — get_nmfi

what: Process a Directory of Luminex Data Files — process_dir
title: Process a Directory of Luminex Data Files — process_dir
text: function processes Luminex plate files within specified directory. plate file processed using process_file(), resulting normalised data saved. Optionally, quality control reports can generated, results multiple plates can merged single file.

title: Process a Directory of Luminex Data Files — process_dir
text: Identify Luminex plate files input_dir, applying recursive search recurse = TRUE. Detect format file based format parameter filename. Locate corresponding layout file using filename use common layout passed layout_filepath parameter. Determine appropriate output directory using get_output_dir(). Process plate file using process_file(). merge_outputs = TRUE, merge normalised data multiple plates single CSV file.

title: Process a Directory of Luminex Data Files — process_dir
text: format specified: plate file named {plate_name}.csv. corresponding layout file named {plate_name}_layout.csv {plate_name}_layout.xlsx. Alternatively, layout_filepath provided, serves unified layout file plates. format equals NULL (automatic detection): plate file named {plate_name}_{format}.csv, {format} either xPONENT INTELLIFLEX. corresponding layout file named using convention , .. {plate_name}_{format}_layout.csv {plate_name}_{format}_layout.xlsx.

title: Process a Directory of Luminex Data Files — process_dir
text: output_dir parameter specifies processed files saved. output_dir NULL, output files saved directory input files. default, output directory structure follows input directory, unless flatten_output_dir = TRUE, saves outputs directly output_dir. Output filenames follow convention used process_file(). plate named {plate_name}, normalised output files named : {plate_name}_RAU.csv RAU normalisation. {plate_name}_nMFI.csv nMFI normalisation. {plate_name}_MFI.csv MFI normalisation. generate_reports = TRUE, quality control report every plate saved {plate_name}_report.pdf. merge_outputs = TRUE, merged normalised files named : merged_RAU_{timestamp}.csv merged_nMFI_{timestamp}.csv merged_MFI_{timestamp}.csv generate_multiplate_reports = TRUE, multiplate quality control report saved multiplate_report_{timestamp}.pdf.

title: Process a Directory of Luminex Data Files — process_dir
code: process_dir(   input_dir,   output_dir = NULL,   recurse = FALSE,   flatten_output_dir = FALSE,   layout_filepath = NULL,   format = "xPONENT",   normalisation_types = c("MFI", "RAU", "nMFI"),   generate_reports = FALSE,   generate_multiplate_reports = FALSE,   merge_outputs = TRUE,   column_collision_strategy = "intersection",   return_plates = FALSE,   dry_run = FALSE,   verbose = TRUE,   ... )

title: Process a Directory of Luminex Data Files — process_dir
text: input_dir (character(1)) Path directory containing plate files. Can contain subdirectories recurse = TRUE. output_dir (character(1), optional) Path directory output files saved. Defaults NULL (input directory). recurse (logical(1), default = FALSE) TRUE, searches plate files subdirectories well. flatten_output_dir (logical(1), default = FALSE) TRUE, saves output files directly output_dir, ignoring input directory structure. layout_filepath (character(1), optional) Path layout file. NULL, function attempts detect automatically. format (character(1), optional) Luminex data format. NULL, automatically detected. Options: 'xPONENT', 'INTELLIFLEX'. default equals 'xPONENT'. normalisation_types (character(), default = c("MFI", "RAU", "nMFI")) normalisation types apply. Supported values: "MFI", "RAU", "nMFI". generate_reports (logical(1), default = FALSE) TRUE, generates single plate quality control reports processed plate file. generate_multiplate_reports (logical(1), default = FALSE) TRUE, generates multiplate quality control report processed plates. merge_outputs (logical(1), default = TRUE) TRUE, merges normalised data single CSV file per normalisation type. merged file named merged_{normalisation_type}_{timestamp}.csv. column_collision_strategy (character(1), default = 'intersection') Determines handle missing extra columns merging outputs. Options: 'union' (include columns), 'intersection' (include common columns). return_plates (logical(1), default = FALSE) TRUE, returns list processed plates sorted experiment date. dry_run (logical(1), default = FALSE) TRUE, prints file details without processing . verbose (logical(1), default = TRUE) TRUE, prints detailed processing information. ... Additional arguments passed process_file().

title: Process a Directory of Luminex Data Files — process_dir
text: return_plates = TRUE, returns sorted list Plate objects. Otherwise, returns NULL.

what: Process a File to Generate Normalised Data and Reports — process_file
title: Process a File to Generate Normalised Data and Reports — process_file
text: function reads Luminex plate file calling read_luminex_data() processes calling process_plate(). optionally generates also quality control report using generate_plate_report(). reads specified plate file, processes plate object using specified normalisation types (including raw MFI values), saves results. generate_report = TRUE, quality control report also generated.

title: Process a File to Generate Normalised Data and Reports — process_file
code: process_file(   plate_filepath,   layout_filepath,   output_dir = "normalised_data",   format = "xPONENT",   generate_report = FALSE,   process_plate = TRUE,   normalisation_types = c("MFI", "RAU", "nMFI"),   blank_adjustment = FALSE,   verbose = TRUE,   ... )

title: Process a File to Generate Normalised Data and Reports — process_file
text: plate_filepath (character(1)) Path Luminex plate file. layout_filepath (character(1)) Path corresponding layout file. output_dir (character(1), default = 'normalised_data') Directory output files saved. exist, created. format (character(1), default = 'xPONENT') Format Luminex data. Available options: 'xPONENT', 'INTELLIFLEX'. generate_report (logical(1), default = FALSE) TRUE, generates quality control report using generate_plate_report(). process_plate (logical(1), default = TRUE) TRUE, processes plate data using process_plate(). FALSE, reads plate file returns plate object without processing. normalisation_types (character(), default = c("MFI", "RAU", "nMFI")) List normalisation types apply. Supported values: c("MFI", "RAU", "nMFI"). blank_adjustment (logical(1), default = FALSE) TRUE, performs blank adjustment processing. verbose (logical(1), default = TRUE) TRUE, prints additional information execution. ... Additional arguments passed read_luminex_data(), generate_plate_report() process_plate().

title: Process a File to Generate Normalised Data and Reports — process_file
text: Plate object containing processed data.

title: Process a File to Generate Normalised Data and Reports — process_file
text: Read plate file layout file. Process plate data using specified normalisation types (MFI, RAU, nMFI). Save processed data CSV files specified output_dir. files named {plate_name}_{normalisation_type}.csv. Optionally, generate quality control report. report saved HTML file output_dir, name {plate_name}_report.html.

title: Process a File to Generate Normalised Data and Reports — process_file

Trying other possibilies. #> Successfully parsed datetime string using order: mdY IM p #>  #> New plate object has been created with name: CovidOISExPONTENT_CO_reduced! #>  #> Processing plate 'CovidOISExPONTENT_CO_reduced' #> Extracting the raw MFI to the output dataframe #> Saving the computed MFI values to a CSV file located in: '/tmp/RtmpRMSIkp/CovidOISExPONTENT_CO_reduced_MFI.csv' #> Fitting the models and predicting RAU for each analyte #> Saving the computed RAU values to a CSV file located in: '/tmp/RtmpRMSIkp/CovidOISExPONTENT_CO_reduced_RAU.csv' #> Computing nMFI values for each analyte #> Saving the computed nMFI values to a CSV file located in: '/tmp/RtmpRMSIkp/CovidOISExPONTENT_CO_reduced_nMFI.csv' #> Plate with 49 samples and 2 analytes  # Example 2: Process the plate for only RAU normalisation process_file(plate_file, layout_file, output_dir = example_dir, normalisation_types = c("RAU")) #> Reading Luminex data from: /home/runner/work/_temp/Library/SerolyzeR/extdata/CovidOISExPONTENT_CO_reduced.csv #> using format xPONENT #> Failed to extract from BatchMetadata: BatchStartTime not found in BatchMetadata. #> Failed to extract from raw header: BatchStartTime not found in raw header. #> Fallback datetime successfully extracted from ProgramMetadata. #> Could not parse datetime string using default datetime format. what: Process Plate Data and Save Normalised Output — process_plate
title: Process Plate Data and Save Normalised Output — process_plate
text: Processes Luminex plate computes normalised values using specified normalisation_type. Depending chosen method, function performs blank adjustment, fits models, extracts values test samples. Optionally, results can saved CSV file.

title: Process Plate Data and Save Normalised Output — process_plate
code: process_plate(   plate,   filename = NULL,   output_dir = "normalised_data",   write_output = TRUE,   normalisation_type = "RAU",   data_type = "Median",   sample_type_filter = "ALL",   blank_adjustment = FALSE,   verbose = TRUE,   reference_dilution = 1/400,   ... )

title: Process Plate Data and Save Normalised Output — process_plate
text: plate Plate object containing raw processed Luminex data. filename (character(1), optional) Output CSV filename. NULL, defaults "{plate_name}_{normalisation_type}.csv". File extension auto-corrected .csv missing. absolute path given, output_dir ignored. output_dir (character(1), default = "normalised_data") Directory CSV saved. created exist. NULL, current working directory used. write_output (logical(1), default = TRUE) Whether write output disk. normalisation_type (character(1), default = 'RAU') normalisation method apply. Allowed values: c(MFI, RAU, nMFI). data_type (character(1), default = "Median") data type use normalisation (e.g., "Median"). sample_type_filter (character()) types samples normalise. (e.g., "TEST", "STANDARD CURVE"). can also vector sample types. case, dataframe multiple sample types returned. default equals "", corresponds processing sample types. blank_adjustment (logical(1), default =  FALSE) Whether apply blank adjustment processing. verbose (logical(1), default = TRUE) Whether print additional information execution. reference_dilution (numeric(1) character(1), default = 1/400) Target dilution used nMFI calculation. Ignored types. Can numeric (e.g., 0.0025) string (e.g., "1/400"). ... Additional arguments passed model fitting function create_standard_curve_model_analyte() predict.Model

title: Process Plate Data and Save Normalised Output — process_plate
text: data frame computed values, test samples rows analytes columns.

title: Process Plate Data and Save Normalised Output — process_plate
text: Supported normalisation types: RAU (Relative Antibody Units): Requires model fitting. Produces estimates using standard curve. See create_standard_curve_model_analyte details. nMFI (Normalised Median Fluorescence Intensity): Requires reference dilution. See get_nmfi. MFI (Blank-adjusted Median Fluorescence Intensity): Returns raw MFI values (adjusted blanks, requested).

title: Process Plate Data and Save Normalised Output — process_plate
text: Optionally perform blank adjustment. Fit model analyte using standard curve data. Predict RAU values test samples. Aggregate optionally save results.

title: Process Plate Data and Save Normalised Output — process_plate
text: Optionally perform blank adjustment. Compute normalised MFI using reference_dilution. Aggregate optionally save results.

title: Process Plate Data and Save Normalised Output — process_plate
text: Optionally perform blank adjustment. Return adjusted MFI values.

title: Read Luminex Data — read_luminex_data
text: Plate object containing parsed Luminex data.

title: Read Luminex Data — read_luminex_data
text: function supports two Luminex data formats: xPONENT: Used older Luminex machines. INTELLIFLEX: Used newer Luminex devices.

title: Read Luminex Data — read_luminex_data
text: Validate input parameters, ensuring specified format supported. Read plate file using appropriate parser: xPONENT files read using read_xponent_format(). INTELLIFLEX files read using read_intelliflex_format(). Post-process extracted data: Validate required data columns (Median, Count). Extract sample locations analyte names. Parse date time experiment.

title: Read Luminex Data — read_luminex_data
text: Plate File (plate_filepath): CSV file containing Luminex fluorescence intensity data. Layout File (layout_filepath) (optional): Excel CSV file containing plate layout. layout file contain table 8 rows 12 columns, cell corresponds well location. values table represent sample names well.

title: Read Luminex Data — read_luminex_data
text: read_luminex_data() method automatically detects sample types based sample names, unless provided sample_types parameter. sample types detected used translate_sample_names_to_sample_types() method. documentation method, can accessed command ?translate_sample_names_to_sample_types, can find detailed description sample types detection.

title: Read Luminex Data — read_luminex_data
text: cases, want analyse sample name twice one plate. package allows situations, assume user knows . importing sample names (either layout file plate file), function check duplicates. found, issue warning like: Duplicate sample names detected: , B. Renaming make unique. add simple numeric suffixes (e.g. “.1”, “.2”) repeated sample names every name unique keeping original text easy recognize.

title: Read Luminex Data — read_luminex_data
code: # Read a Luminex plate file with an associated layout file plate_file <- system.file("extdata", "CovidOISExPONTENT.csv", package = "SerolyzeR") layout_file <- system.file("extdata", "CovidOISExPONTENT_layout.csv", package = "SerolyzeR") plate <- read_luminex_data(plate_file, layout_file) #> Reading Luminex data from: /home/runner/work/_temp/Library/SerolyzeR/extdata/CovidOISExPONTENT.csv #> using format xPONENT #> Failed to extract from BatchMetadata: BatchStartTime not found in BatchMetadata. #> BatchStartTime successfully extracted from the header. #> Could not parse datetime string using default datetime format. Trying other possibilies. #> Successfully parsed datetime string using order: mdY IMS p #>  #> New plate object has been created with name: CovidOISExPONTENT! #>   # Read a Luminex plate file without a layout file plate_file <- system.file("extdata", "CovidOISExPONTENT_CO.csv", package = "SerolyzeR") plate <- read_luminex_data(plate_file, verbose = FALSE) #> Could not parse datetime string using default datetime format. Trying other possibilies. #> Successfully parsed datetime string using order: mdY IMS p #> Warning: Duplicate sample names detected: S. Renaming to make them unique.

title: Translate sample names to sample types — translate_sample_names_to_sample_types
text: Function assigns SampleType samples one c(, BLANK, TEST, NEGATIVE CONTROL, STANDARD CURVE, POSITIVE CONTROL). parses names follows: sample_names sample_names_from_layout equals BLANK, BACKGROUND B, SampleType equals BLANK sample_names sample_names_from_layout equals STANDARD CURVE, SC, S, contains substring 1/\d+ prefix  , S_, S , S CP3, SampleType equals STANDARD CURVE. instance, sample name S_1/2 S 1/2 classified STANDARD CURVE. sample_names sample_names_from_layout equals NEGATIVE CONTROL, N, contains substring NEG, SampleType equals NEGATIVE CONTROL sample_names sample_names_from_layout starts P followed whitespace, POS followed whitespace, sample name followed substring 1/\d+ SampleType equals POSITIVE CONTROL Otherwise, returned SampleType TEST also removes additional suffixes created make.unique() method, , .1, .4.
